{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is presenting with bilateral knee pain that worsens with activity and is alleviated by rest, along with tenderness to palpation of the bony structures on the medial aspect of the knees and crepitus. These findings are consistent with osteoarthritis, which is the most common cause of chronic knee pain in individuals over the age of 45. The physical examination findings of bony enlargement and coolness to touch suggest the presence of osteophytes and inflammation. Given the clinical presentation and physical examination findings, further work-up is not necessary to establish the diagnosis of osteoarthritis. Therefore, the correct answer is D. No further work-up needed.", "answer_choice": "D"}
